clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Mobile Game on Life Quality of Cancer Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Pilot Study : Effects of Mobile Game for Chemotherapy Side Effect Education on Life Quality of Cancer Patients

lead_sponsor.agency: Chung-Ang University Hosptial, Chung-Ang University College of Medicine

clinical_study.source: Chung-Ang University Hosptial, Chung-Ang University College of Medicine

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether functional games can be used to improve the adherence and quality of life of breast cancer patients with chemotherapy.

primary_outcome.description: To obtain comparable estimates of physical activity

arm_group.description: Functional mobile game for chemotherapy side effect education

intervention.description: Functional mobile game for chemotherapy side effect education

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosed with breast cancer
- Receiving breast cancer chemotherapy
- Patients who are using a smartphone and agree to use a mobile functional game
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient with intellectual disability
- Diagnosed with congenital genetic disease
- Patients with a history of acquired brain injury such as cerebral palsy
- Developmental disorders, including autism
- Patients with language or learning disabilities
